Reason: The configuration option _journalAgeThreshold is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the value of _journalAgeThreshold directly impacts the system performance by determining how long journal entries are kept before they are considered old and potentially removed. This affects the size of the journal and the performance of the system in terms of journal storage and retrieval. In the code context provided, _journalAgeThreshold is passed as a parameter to the PersistentJournal constructor, indicating its importance in the journaling process and system performance.
